Hi
Some time ago I've written a runner for JUnit which is a replacement for=
 the standard Parameterized runner - is easier & more flexible to use, give=
s nicer output in IDEs. I've made it available at http://code.google.com/p/=
junitparams. The website has a description of all the features.

JUnitParam=
s now updated to work properly with JUnit 4.10.

Pawel
